Mahindra's Farm Equipment Sector (FES) announced its tractor sales numbers for April 2025.

Domestic sales were 38,516 units, an 8% increase compared to April 2024.

Total tractor sales (Domestic + Exports) reached 40,054 units, up from 37,039 units for the same period last year.

Exports for the month stood at 1,538 units, representing a 25% growth over last year.

Mahindra Auto reported overall auto sales of 84,170 vehicles in April 2025, a 19% growth compared to April 2024.

SUV sales reached 52,330 units, registering a 28% growth.

M&M's consolidated revenue for FY25 stood at ₹1,59,211 crore, a 14% increase year-on-year (YoY).

Consolidated PAT (Profit After Tax) for FY25 was ₹12,929 crore, up 20% YoY.

The company declared a dividend of ₹25.3 per share for FY25.

Mahindra's new electric SUVs, the BE 6 and XEV 9e, have driven record sales in May 2025.

Production of the BE 6 and XEV 9e at the Chakan plant reached 3,692 units, with 4,021 units dispatched to dealerships across the country.

Mahindra holds a 21% share of the electric passenger vehicle market, selling 2,695 EVs in May,according to Autocar Professional.

The company is set to introduce new battery and trim combinations for the BE 6 and XEV 9e to cater to a broader range of customers.

Mahindra has increased the production of the BE 6 Batman Edition from 300 units to 999 units due to overwhelming demand.

Mahindra announced the inclusion of Dolby Atmos in select variants of the2025 XUV 3XO, making it the most affordable SUV globally to offer this feature.

News and updates regarding Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) as of May 1, 2025:

It's important to note that some articles covering May 2025 performance were published in early June, based on the May sales figures that became available around May 31/June 1.
